title: Development of Constructivist-Based Instructional Design Models and Learning Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design concepts and secondary education experience
context.additional_context: Learners create and evaluate instructional design models, emphasizing collaborative learning based on constructivist principles, with supplementary smartphone resources.

learning_goals: Learners can generate customized instructional design models using the five stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation).
Learners can construct learner-centered dynamic/non-linear instructional design models according to constructivist principles.
Learners iteratively refine instructional design models based on peer feedback and implement creative expressions using metaphors.
Learners develop instructional design models, including assessment systems applicable to real-world secondary education scenarios.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
